programmes.show_description: Soup to Nuts: The concluding part of the thrilling espionage series. John must escape captivity to intercept the attack, but those who want it to proceed will stop at nothing.
Your daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection.
Shopping from home.
Born to Blush Unseen: Classic British sitcom. Oliver has something to show from his gardening efforts when he crosses an aster with a dahlia and produces a rare bloom.
The Inspector's Niece: '70s sitcom following the capers of bus driver Stan. When a beautiful young woman begins training at the depot, nobody realises that she is Blakey's niece.
A nervous Ross agrees to lure Shane into a trap set by Eli and Marlon. Lexi seeks to impress Carl by drumming up more business, Val tells Diane the Woolpack needs a new look.
Donna is furious when she uncovers Ross and Marlon's scheme to knock Shane down a peg or two. Lexi gains inside information about Carl and Donald's plan to rebrand their company.
Michelle is in turmoil over how to deal with Alex, who walks into the Rovers to patch things up with her. Roy decides to visit Hayley in Africa.
A dejected Alex goes missing after meeting Michelle and is later escorted back to the pub by a police officer. Jack discovers he's won 3000 pounds on the horses.
Widows and Orphans: There is plenty on Frost's plate when senior citizens are targeted in a string of vicious attacks, but at least he can call on his new female sergeant for help.
Changing Roles: Rachel takes a key witness to a murder trial into protection in Aidensfield - and tries to keep him safe long enough to testify - and Joe bumps into an old flame.
A Brush with the Law: The local hunt arrives in Aidensfield, Lord Ashfordly comes under suspicion of arson when old rivalries surface.
Strangler's Wood: Barnaby and Troy are led into the murky and clandestine world of Midsomer Worthy when a woman is killed in local woodland nine years after three identical murders.
TJ is rushed to hospital and diagnosed with an E-coli infection. Matthew fires Jasmine to balance his books and Donna thinks her luck at work has changed when Shane calls a truce.
Environmental Health suggest Jo's cheese may be responsible for the outbreak of E-coli. Gray is visited by Perdy's divorce lawyer and Lily inspires Belle to start her a business.
Ryan is furious when Michelle offers Alex a roof over his head after he's caught shoplifting, and Jack's place is turned upside-down in a bid to find the winning betting slip.
As Carla struggles to hide her anguish, Tony turns up and secretly takes her flat keys from her handbag. Alex's presence at the Rovers continues to divide Michelle and her family.
The Heart of a Man: When a local industrial dispute threatens to get out of hand, Miller's personal feelings almost get the better of him and Rachel is called in to investigate.
Out of the Long, Dark Night: Joe investigates when vandals target a local couple - and uncovers a dark history - and Peggy doesn't know what to do to shift a ton of scrap metal.
Sins of Commission: Murder mystery drama. When Midsomer hosts its annual Literary Festival, an author is found with his neck broken and more writers die before a winner is announced.
Quartet: A death at an international sporting event leads Endeavour to investigate more than a crime, and Thursday continues to delve into the underworld activity of Oxford.
Ghost Train: When a girl falls to her death from a Ferris wheel, it is thought to be a tragic accident until DS Satchell's aunt comes forward with suspicions of foul play.
Friends in High Places: Sitcom about a bus driver and his conductor pal. Jack suggests that Mum should work as a cook in the depot canteen.
Your daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection.
Shopping from home.
Fasten Your Seatbelt: Classic British sitcom. Simon and Oliver decide to fly to Canada to see their grandson.
Brew It Yourself: Sitcom about a two-man bus crew. Stan turns up to work drunk after sampling too much home-made beer.
TJ is rushed to hospital and diagnosed with an E-coli infection. Matthew fires Jasmine to balance his books and Donna thinks her luck at work has changed when Shane calls a truce.
Environmental Health suggest Jo's cheese may be responsible for the outbreak of E-coli. Gray is visited by Perdy's divorce lawyer and Lily inspires Belle to start her a business.
Ryan is furious when Michelle offers Alex a roof over his head after he's caught shoplifting, and Jack's place is turned upside-down in a bid to find the winning betting slip.
As Carla struggles to hide her anguish, Tony turns up and secretly takes her flat keys from her handbag. Alex's presence at the Rovers continues to divide Michelle and her family.
Nothing to Hide: Detective drama series. Detective Inspector Jack Frost is called upon to solve the death of a young drug addict amid allegations of police incompetence.
The Heart of a Man: When a local industrial dispute threatens to get out of hand, Miller's personal feelings almost get the better of him and Rachel is called in to investigate.
Out of the Long, Dark Night: Joe investigates when vandals target a local couple - and uncovers a dark history - and Peggy doesn't know what to do to shift a ton of scrap metal.
Dead Man's Eleven: Feature-length drama. DCI Barnaby is enmeshed in a succession of calculated murders when the wife of a wealthy landowner is bludgeoned to death with a cricket bat.
Gray meets Perdy and is shocked to see where she has been living. Jo and Andy are cleared by Environmental Health after the E-coli outbreak and Eli helps Belle with her business.
Katie is in turmoil when Gray mistakenly calls her Perdy after visiting his wife again. Laurel and Ashley lock horns over what to do about Arthur, and Matthew's car is vandalised.
A nervous Carla arms herself before confronting the intruder. Paul discovers Jack's winning betting slip but keeps quiet, while Violet and Jamie consider leaving Weatherfield.
Paul collects the winnings from Jack's bet and pays Dan to stay quiet. Jamie and Violet keep their move a secret from Sean, and Liam and Maria return from their honeymoon.
Take Three Girls: Carol and Dr Chris clash over the care of a pregnant teenager, and Peggy is pleased as punch when she thinks that David has caught a certain somebody's eye.
Hey! Hey! LBJ!: The police spring into action when a teenage girl disappears, and Peggy thinks that she and David have struck gold when he finds an old metal detector.
Black Ice: Crime drama. DCI Vera Stanhope and her team face a series of daunting challenges.
Icarus: The disappearance of a teacher at a public school tests Endeavour's investigative skills, and the continued investigation into Oxford's criminal underworld proves deadly.
Shooter - Part One: DS Satchell and his family find themselves the target of a notorious crime gang when he witnesses the slaying of an informer following a jewellery raid.
